sen.j: 岡田鴨神社（おかだかもじんじゃ）は、京都府木津川市（旧相楽郡加茂町 (京都府)）にある神社である。
sen.e: Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kamo-cho, Soraku County).
Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kamo-cho, Soraku County).
Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture (formerly Kamo-cho, Soraku-gun County).

sen.j: 式内社で、旧社格は郷社。
sen.e: The shrine is listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities in the book of regulations of the Engi era) and was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.

The shrine is listed in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (register of shrines and deities in the book of regulations of the Engi era) and was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.
The shrine is Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)) and was ranked as a gosha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 賀茂氏の祖である賀茂建角身命を祀る。
sen.e: It enshrines Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, an ancestor of the Kamo clan.
It enshrines Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, an ancestor of the Kamo clan.
It enshrines Kamo Taketsunumi no Mikoto, an ancestor of the Kamo clan.
History
History
History

sen.j: 山城国風土記（逸文）によれば、建角身命は大和国葛城から山城国岡田賀茂を経て洛北の賀茂御祖神社（下鴨神社）に鎮まったとある。
sen.e: According to the regional gazetteer of Yamashiro Province (lost writing), Taketsunumi no mikoto was transferred from Katsuragi in Yamato Province to Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine (Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) in the north of Kyoto via Okada Kamo in Yamashiro Province.

According to the regional gazetteer of Yamashiro Province (lost writing), Taketsunumi no mikoto was transferred from Katsuragi in Yamato Province to Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine (Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) in the north of Kyoto via Okada Kamo in Yamashiro Province.

According to the regional gazetteer of Yamashiro Province (lost writing), Taketsunumi no Mikoto was transferred from Katsuragi in Yamato Province to Kamo Mioya-jinja Shrine (commonly known as Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) in the north of Kyoto via Okada Kamo in Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 崇神天皇の御代に賀茂氏によって、建角身命に縁のある岡田賀茂の地に下鴨神社より勧請を受けて創建されたものと伝わる。
sen.e: Legend has it that the shrine was founded by the Kamo clan during the reign of Emperor Sujin, after they received from Shimogamo-jinja Shrine the divided deity of Taketsunumi no mikoto, a kami with a connection to the area of Okada Kamo,

Legend has it that the shrine was founded by the Kamo clan during the reign of Emperor Sujin, after they received from Shimogamo-jinja Shrine the divided deity of Taketsunumi no mikoto, a kami with a connection to the area of Okada Kamo,

Legend has it that the shrine was founded by the Kamo clan during the reign of the Emperor Sujin, after they received from Shimogamo-jinja Shrine the divided deity of Taketsunumi no Mikoto, a god with a connection to the area of Okada Kamo,
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: 文献の初見は『日本三代実録』貞観 (日本)元年（859年）年正月27日条の当社に従五位上の神階を授けるという記述である。
sen.e: The first historical reference to the shrine appears in the "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 when it was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

The first historical reference to the shrine appears in the "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 when it was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

The first historical reference to the shrine appears in the "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) entry for the 27th day of the 1st month of the year 859 (March 9, 859) when it was granted the rank of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では大社に列している。
sen.e: It is classified as a taisha in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.
It is classified as a taisha in the Engishiki Jinmyocho.
It is classified as a taisha (grand shrine) in Engishiki Jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 当社は元々現在地より北方（木津川 (京都府)河岸に「鴨大明神趾」がある）に鎮座していたが、木津川の流路が変わりたびたび水害に遭うようになったため、現在地に遷座した。
sen.e: Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was originally located north of its current site (the 'remains of Kamo Daimyojin Shrine' on the bank of Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture)) but water damage caused by the frequently changing route of Kizu-gawa river led to it being relocated to its current site.

Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was originally located north of its current site (the 'remains of Kamo Daimyojin Shrine' on the bank of Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture)) but water damage caused by the frequently changing route of Kizu-gawa river led to it being relocated to its current site.

Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was originally located north of its current site (the 'remains of Kamo Daimyojin Shrine' on the bank of the Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture)) but water damage caused by the frequently changing route of the Kizu-gawa river led to it being relocated to its current site.

sen.j: 現在地は元明天皇の岡田離宮の旧跡と伝えられる。
sen.e: The current site is the former location of Emperor Genmei's Okada Villa.
The current site is the former location of Emperor Genmei's Okada Villa.
The current site is the former location of the Emperor Genmei's Okada Villa.

sen.j: 離宮が廃された後、その旧跡を保存するために村人が神社を創建し、「天神社」と称した。
sen.e: After the villa fell out of use, the villagers founded a shrine in order to protect the site and named it "Tenjinsha".
After the villa fell out of use, the villagers founded a shrine in order to protect the site and named it "Tenjinsha".
After the villa fell out of use, the villagers founded a shrine in order to protect the site and named it 'Tenjinsha.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変えました。

sen.j: その境内に岡田鴨神社を遷座したものである。
sen.e: Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was relocated to the precinct of this shrine.
Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was relocated to the precinct of this shrine.
Okada Kamo-jinja Shrine was relocated to the precinct of this shrine.

sen.j: 現在、天満宮は境内社となっている。
sen.e: Tenman-gu Shrine is currently a sub-shrine within the main precinct.
Tenman-gu Shrine is currently a sub-shrine within the main precinct.
Tenman-gu Shrine is currently a sub-shrine within the main precinct.
